info.title: Elkaavie API Documentation
info.description:
## Elkaavie API Documentation

This is the official API documentation for the Elkaavie accommodation booking system.
The API provides endpoints for managing bookings, rooms, user authentication, and more.

### Authentication

Most endpoints require authentication using a Bearer token. To obtain a token, use the `/api/login` endpoint.

### Features

- User authentication and registration
- Room availability and booking management
- Payment verification
- User profile management

message.example: Registration successful. Please check your email for verification code.

post.summary: Auto-login a user using a secure token

200.description: Return the token and booking ID for redirection

get.summary: Generate an auto-login redirect URL with token

message.example: Google redirect failed. Please try again.
Email verified successfully and logged in

get.summary:
Delete functionality removed to avoid ambiguity
Bookings should be managed through status changes (cancelled, rejected, etc.)
rather than being deleted from the system

Get details for a specific booking
Accessible by admin or the booking owner only

parameters.name: booking
parameters.description: - The booking to view (auto-resolved by Laravel route model binding)

put.summary:
Update booking details (admin only)
Allows modification of booking dates, guests, and other details

200.description: Return the full URL for the uploaded image

post.summary:
Create a new booking
Handles validation, file uploads, and creation of booking record

get.summary:
List all bookings in the system (admin only)
Returns a paginated list of bookings with related user and room data

put.summary:
Update booking status (admin only)
Handles workflow state transitions and related actions

message.example: An error occurred while processing your request. Please try again later.
Unable to send password reset link. Please try again later.
Password reset link sent to your email address.
We could not find a user with that email address.
An error occurred while resetting your password.
